title: Douglas Elton - Before the Accident
review:
Overview

Issue 4 of the Hidden Side Comic gives us Douglas Elton, aka El Fuego.  The issue was available in the UK between 8th January and 4th February 2020 and was priced £3.99.  Being the fourth issue of this line of comic it is no surprise that this is El Fuego's first appearance.

Packet

A large image of El Fuego appears on the front of the packet and it clearly shows that he comes with a fire extinguisher and a small flame build.  A couple of ghosts a pictured behind him, as is the Newbury High School (70425).  In the bottom right it states that this is for 6+, which as ever seems a little on the high side as my six-year-old and his friends love this theme and would have had no problem building these comic sets when they were younger.

The back has a nice image of Jack and Parker on the flap of the foil packet adjacent to the Hidden Side logo.  The standard safety information is also provided and the 1:1 image is one of the flame elements in Transparent Bright Orange.

Minifigure

El Fuego is almost perfect and appears as he does in the El Fuego's Stunt Truck set (70421), albeit without the cape here.  The torso and legs appear in a couple of other sets too, and he appears with a ghost head in the JB's Ghost Lap set (70418).  There is no hair element, so he has to keep his printed helmet on.

Main Build/Parts

This set is all about the minifigure, although you get five other parts that build two accessories.  Firstly is his fire extinguisher which is built in the same way they have been for years.  This version mixes Bright Red and White elements.  You also get a Transparent Bright Orange parts to make a flame section.  No parts stand out as anything other than standard, with the exception of the printed parts that make El Fuego.

Verdict

This is a great way to add El Fuego to your collection if you only wanted the characters.  I would have liked to have had the hair element added, after all the ghost from issue 2 had two heads.  Also, very much like the Fireman from the City Comic (951902) the inclusion of a stud launcher instead of the fire extinguisher would have added play value.  His cape could also have been added, but for me that is not really necessary.

This is a good bright minifigure, and with the comic and set combined at the £3.99 price it is fantastic value.  A slight change and one extra part could have improved this.  Again however this set cannot be used with the app.
